When I first played this game, I thought it was just a troll full of memes. And it really was, until the creator added 2 more levels - still full of memes - but slightly more interesting because of their slighlty increased difficulty. I enjoyed it more today than a month ago.

This game is a little shoot'em up inspired by a flash game I believe, so it is really simple to understand and easy to handle. It has pretty straight forward achievements (for the hunters) and Steam cards. Don't read or watch them though not to spoil yourselves, because I was caught by surprise and laughed for a while when playing the game - but of course you need to like memes.

It costs 1 bill, which is quite high since you wont play for that long in order to complete the game (probably 15 mins), unless you're a piece of crap in shoot'em ups, just like me. I got it for free though, in some giveaway. If you have the occasion to grab it, give it a shot. I believe this will be worth since the developper seems to add some content once and a while, whenever he's caught by a meme.

PS : I did not mention the soundtrack, which is weird at times or very interesting, but definitely adds some style to game. The only problem is that you will end up listening to it repeatedly if you suck at shoot'em ups.

reviewText:
Product received for free

The game has, indeed, been provided to me for free to be reviewed, but that does not influence my review in any way.
Go to the bottom for the TL;DR if you don't feel like reading the entire review. SAMOLIOTIK is a pixel designed shooter with a lot of variety between the levels which can't be selected, but can be reached by advancing in the game, you get to a new one by defeating the boss of the previous one. Predominant colors vary, enemies vary, bosses vary. The soundtrack is awesome, if you like it, you might also want to purchase the soundtrack DLC. At first glance, the game might seem linear and boring, but as I said there's a lot of variation between levels which are amusing at certain points and there are power ups as well. Also, new content seems to be constantly added to the game but as of now, it seems fairly priced for the content and the experience it offers.

TL;DR : Prons and Cons + my final verdict	 Pros 	 Cons 	+ Really nice pixelated graphics

+ Simple controls, click to shoot, move your mouse left to right to dodge enemies.

+ Good level design, a lot variation between levels

+ Really awesome soundtrack.

+ Amusing at times.

+ Fairly priced and it also seem to be updated with new content frequently	- Doesn't ensure much replayability and also some might find a little bit too short.
Final verdict:   9/10  Really worth giving it try, would definitely recommend it to people who are into pixel designed games

reviewText: Well, I'm not quite sure what to think about this game. For what it is and for the price, it's enjoyable and relaxing, but quite different from other games I've played. You may notice that I only have about eight minutes clocked into the game. That's because within that eight minutes, I completed both levels and feel that I've experienced enough of the game to write a review. This game isn't about completing levels, it's about achieving a high score. The two different levels offered repeat themselves until you get killed and you continue to try to get a new higher score with each attempt. The game could not be more simple. There is no keyboard or controller used, only the mouse. You fly around in a plane like 1942 and shoot at other planes, then dollar signs. The objective is to defeat the flying illuminati, (LOL You will see what I mean). The music adds to the odd nature of the game but somehow fits quite well.I got the game at a steal of 1% off, (from 99 cents to 98 cents). For a dollar, you can't go wrong with an odd but relaxing game like this, but I wouldn't pay more than a dollar for it.
